moves.5... Bxc3+: Keres goes in for the exchange.
moves.6. bxc3 Re8 7. Ne2 e5: Finally challenging Botvinnik's central Pawn mass.
moves.8. Ng3 d6 9. Be2 Nbd7: Slowing his own development by blocking the QB, but ...N-QB3 could provoke a response of P-Q5 from Botvinnik.
moves.10. O-O c5 11. f3: Both players still need to develop their respective QB's and connect their Rooks.
moves.11... cxd4: A questionable exchange -- why undouble Botvinnik's QBP's?
moves.15... Re7 16. Qxd4 Qc7: Focusing his fire on the QBP.
moves.17. c5: Solving the problem by offering to exchange the Pawn.
moves.17... dxc5 18. Rxc5: Gaining time by attacking Keres' Queen.
moves.20... Nbd7: Rushing another piece to the defense of the Monarch.
moves.21. Rxg7+: A brilliant sacrifice that blows apart Keres' defenses.
moves.22... Kg6: As good or bad as anything else.
moves.23. Qe3: Threatens Q-R6 mate. Keres resigns. Well played by Botvinnik.
